question.title: Will a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
question.body:
Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024:

 - Donald Trump
 - Donald Trump Jr.
 - Eric Trump
 - Ivanka Trump
 - Tiffany Trump
 - Melania Trump
 - Barron Trump

metadata.background_info:
Donald John Trump is the 45th and current president of the United States. Before entering politics, he was a businessman and television personality. Trump won a surprise victory in the [2016 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2016_United_States_presidential_election), and sought re-election in the [2020 presidential election.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2020_United_States_presidential_election)

The [Trump family](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Family_of_Donald_Trump) has a net worth reported to be in the single-digit billions, and is now one of the most prominent families in Republican politics. Trump has several adult children, and there is speculation that a Trump political dynasty may emerge in the coming years, with both [Donald Trump Jr. and Ivanka Trump suggested as possible contenders for the presidency.](https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2020/jan/04/donald-trump-jr-ivanka-trump-2024-presidential-election-poll)

 - Donald Trump

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.background_info:
Following the 2020 US election, Former President Donald Trump has hinted his intentions of running again for President in 2024, [saying at a rally in March 2022](https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-promises-to-return-to-the-white-house-in-2024-2022-3), "[...] in 2024, we are going to take back our beautiful White House [...] I will be back and we will be better and stronger than ever before".  [Early polling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) for the Republican Party nomination frequently shows Trump as the top choice among respondents.  

Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has not publicly expressed his intention of running (as of [June 2022](https://floridapolitics.com/archives/531919-ron-desantis-swats-away-2024-speculation-yet-again/)), though Fox News producers have [called him](https://www.tampabay.com/news/florida-politics/2021/08/13/inside-fox-news-desantis-is-the-future-of-the-party-and-hes-taking-advantage/) "the future of the Republican Party".  DeSantis is a frequent [second-place favorite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) in polling behind Trump.

Former Vice President Mike Pence has also hinted his intentions of seeking the nomination; [in April 2022](https://archive.ph/uFSD4), when asked if he would run even if Donald Trump were also running, he responded "We’ll go where we’re called".

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

metadata.background_info:
Scotland is one of the UK’s four constituent nations - and its politics are currently dominated by the [Scottish National Party](https://whatscotlandthinks.org/), a party whose core aim is to remove Scotland from the UK and become an independent country. 

The SNP government in Edinburgh previously successfully negotiated with the UK-wide government for the right to hold a referendum, [which took place in 2014](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_Scottish_independence_referendum). The “No” side (“Better Together”) won 55% to 45%. The SNP has, however, won every Scottish national election since that date.

The SNP wish to have a fresh vote - stating that Brexit has changed the terms of the argument. The UK government has, to date, refused to countenance permitting such a vote. Under the Scotland Act, the Edinburgh government does not have the power to hold one [without permission.](https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1998/46/section/30)

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an official, authorized referendum on its independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom takes place in Scotland, and it occurs before May 3, 2024. This referendum can be an "advisory" referendum; it is not required for the referendum to possess any legal authority.

A referendum will not be considered resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of vote where the UK government has refused to grant approval for the referendum, nor by a vote arranged by civil society organizations. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an official referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Scotland carries out a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum takes place before May 3, 2024. It is acceptable for this referendum to be an "advisory" one; it does not need to have any legal binding consequences.

A referendum will not be considered resolved if it is a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type referendum where the UK government has refused to grant permission for the vote, nor will it be resolved by a vote organized by civil society organizations. The referendum must have the approval of the London government.

para_P.title: Could Scotland potentially hold an official referendum regarding independence before May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a response of **Yes** if Scotland holds a referendum on its independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum occurs prior to May 3, 2024. It is permissible for this referendum to be of an "advisory" nature; it does not need to carry any legal binding effects.

A referendum will not be deemed resolved if it is a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style referendum where the UK government has not authorized the vote, nor will it be resolved by a vote organized by civil society groups. The referendum must have the consent of the London government.

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

metadata.background_info:
Following the 2020 US election, Former President Donald Trump has hinted his intentions of running again for President in 2024, [saying at a rally in March 2022](https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-promises-to-return-to-the-white-house-in-2024-2022-3), "[...] in 2024, we are going to take back our beautiful White House [...] I will be back and we will be better and stronger than ever before".  [Early polling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) for the Republican Party nomination frequently shows Trump as the top choice among respondents.  

Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has not publicly expressed his intention of running (as of [June 2022](https://floridapolitics.com/archives/531919-ron-desantis-swats-away-2024-speculation-yet-again/)), though Fox News producers have [called him](https://www.tampabay.com/news/florida-politics/2021/08/13/inside-fox-news-desantis-is-the-future-of-the-party-and-hes-taking-advantage/) "the future of the Republican Party".  DeSantis is a frequent [second-place favorite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) in polling behind Trump.

Former Vice President Mike Pence has also hinted his intentions of seeking the nomination; [in April 2022](https://archive.ph/uFSD4), when asked if he would run even if Donald Trump were also running, he responded "We’ll go where we’re called".

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

metadata.background_info:
The 2024 Olympic games is a sporting competition which takes place every four years. It involves a range of different events across multiple sports.

At the Olympic Games, Gold, Silver and Bronze medals are awarded to 1st, 2nd and 3rd place in each event. (In some events two Bronze medals are awarded mostly combat sports).

The US team is one of the most successful teams in recent Olympics, topping the medal table in 2020, 2016, 2012, 2004, 2000. Will they repeat that in 2024?

*Related questions*

* [How many medals will Team USA win in Paris 2024?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/7665/total-medals-won-by-the-usa-at-paris-2024/)
* [Will France come in the Top 5 at Paris 2024?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/7669/france-home-game-advantage/

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Medal Standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the USA Olympic Team is the sole highest-ranked team at the Paris 2024 Olympics. It will be deemed unclear if the Paris Olympics are not held before the year 2027. It will be regarded as negative if any other team matches or surpasses the ranking of the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in Gold) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in Silver) Total Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Will the USA lead the Olympic Medal Rankings in Paris 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the United States Olympic Team stands as the (sole) highest positioned team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be deemed uncertain if the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027. It will be regarded as negative if any other team attains a higher or equal rank compared to the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. The Count of Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties in 1) The Count of Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties in 2) The Count of Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Will the USA top the Olympic Medal Standings in Paris 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered positively if the United States Olympic Team is the (only) highest ranked team at the Paris Olympics in 2024. It will be considered uncertain if the Paris Games do not take place before 2027. It will be seen as negative if any other team achieves a higher or equal ranking compared to the US team.

The medal rankings are established by counting all the medals won by each country and ordering them according to:

1. The Number of Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties in 1) The Number of Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties in 2) The Number of Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

metadata.background_info:
*Related Questions on Metaculus:*

* [How many medals will Team USA win at Paris 2024?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/7665/total-medals-won-by-the-usa-at-paris-2024/)
* [Will the Team USA top the medal table at Paris 2024?](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/7664/usa-most-successful-olympic-team-in-paris/)

----

[There is a phenomenon at the Olympics where by the host country tends to outperform it's recent performances](https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/is-there-home-field-advantage-at-the-olympics/)

France is hosting the Olympics in 2021. Will they place significantly higher in the medal table than they have in recent years. [Their last 6 placings were](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France_at_the_Olympics#Medals_by_Summer_Games):

```
2000: 6th 
2004: 7th 
2008: 10th 
2012: 7th 
2016: 7th
2020: 8th
```

para_P.title: Will France achieve a Top 5 finish at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France secures a position within the top 5 (ties will also be counted positively) during the Olympics scheduled for 2024. It will be deemed unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the overall number of medals earned by each participating nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of ties at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of ties at 2) Total Bronze Medals

para_P.title: Will France finish among the Top 5 in the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France finishes within the top 5 (ties are counted as affirmative) at the Olympics occurring in 2024. It will be regarded as uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in Gold) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in Silver) Total Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Will France rank in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This question will be deemed positive if France secures a position within the top 5 (including ties as positive) at the Olympic Games scheduled for 2024. If the Olympics do not take place in 2024, the outcome will be considered uncertain.

The ranking of nations is based on the cumulative number of medals won, organized by:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in Gold) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in Silver) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will BJP form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the BJP has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections.  All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024)

metadata.background_info:
India has a [parliamentary government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elections_in_India) system, with 543 single-member constituencies which use first-past-the-post voting to elect MPs to the [Lok Sabha](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lok_Sabha), the lower house in Indian Parliament.  The [Prime Minister](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_India) is appointed by the President and a majority vote of the Lok Sabha; the Prime Minister then leads this governing coalition.  Elections must be held every 5 years, but elections may be called earlier if the President dissolves the Lok Sabha.

The Bhartiya Janata Party (BJP) has been in power at the Union government level since 2014, with [Narendra Modi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Narendra_Modi) as Prime Minister, with the Indian National Congress (INC) as the main challenger. The next national elections are scheduled for May 2024.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.background_info:
Following the 2020 US election, Former President Donald Trump has hinted his intentions of running again for President in 2024, [saying at a rally in March 2022](https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-promises-to-return-to-the-white-house-in-2024-2022-3), "[...] in 2024, we are going to take back our beautiful White House [...] I will be back and we will be better and stronger than ever before".  [Early polling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) for the Republican Party nomination frequently shows Trump as the top choice among respondents.  

Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has not publicly expressed his intention of running (as of [June 2022](https://floridapolitics.com/archives/531919-ron-desantis-swats-away-2024-speculation-yet-again/)), though Fox News producers have [called him](https://www.tampabay.com/news/florida-politics/2021/08/13/inside-fox-news-desantis-is-the-future-of-the-party-and-hes-taking-advantage/) "the future of the Republican Party".  DeSantis is a frequent [second-place favorite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) in polling behind Trump.

Former Vice President Mike Pence has also hinted his intentions of seeking the nomination; [in April 2022](https://archive.ph/uFSD4), when asked if he would run even if Donald Trump were also running, he responded "We’ll go where we’re called".

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will lead to a resolution of **No**. This question is open to additional candidates who may emerge in the future.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the resolution is strictly based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

This question will be answered with **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. question.title: Will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently considered; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.background_info:
Following the 2020 US election, Former President Donald Trump has hinted his intentions of running again for President in 2024, [saying at a rally in March 2022](https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-promises-to-return-to-the-white-house-in-2024-2022-3), "[...] in 2024, we are going to take back our beautiful White House [...] I will be back and we will be better and stronger than ever before".  [Early polling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) for the Republican Party nomination frequently shows Trump as the top choice among respondents.  

Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has not publicly expressed his intention of running (as of [June 2022](https://floridapolitics.com/archives/531919-ron-desantis-swats-away-2024-speculation-yet-again/)), though Fox News producers have [called him](https://www.tampabay.com/news/florida-politics/2021/08/13/inside-fox-news-desantis-is-the-future-of-the-party-and-hes-taking-advantage/) "the future of the Republican Party".  DeSantis is a frequent [second-place favorite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) in polling behind Trump.

Former Vice President Mike Pence has also hinted his intentions of seeking the nomination; [in April 2022](https://archive.ph/uFSD4), when asked if he would run even if Donald Trump were also running, he responded "We’ll go where we’re called".

question.title: Will Russian athletes be barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Russian athletes are barred from competing at the 2024 Olympics under either (i) the Russian flag, (ii) The Russian Olympic Committee's flag, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. This will resolve based on the official list of countries and athletes present at the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or based on credible media reports, indicating that the 2024 Olympics are underway or have concluded without Russian participation. For the question to resolve as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russians can be competing at the 2024 Olympics. 34 was chosen as 10% of [Russian athletes that participated in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport specific exceptions.

If more than 34 Russian athletes compete at the 2024 Olympics, this question will resolve as **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or afterwards, this question resolves as ambiguously.

metadata.background_info:
After the [Russian's invasion of Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine) in February 2022, Russia has been subject to a large amount of international pressure. That pressure has taken many different forms;  [sanctions](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/10266/russia-sanctions-1-year-after-invasion/), [boycotts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2022_boycott_of_Russia_and_Belarus), protests, oil and gas embargoes, corporate divestment, and more. Many individuals, corporations, and countries have taking action to show international solidarity with Ukraine.

In the sporting world, Russia has been banned from a number of recent international events. On Feb 28th 2022, four days after Russia invaded, FIFA made an unprecedented decision to [ban Russian clubs and the national team from all competitions](https://www.fifa.com/tournaments/mens/worldcup/qatar2022/media-releases/fifa-uefa-suspend-russian-clubs-and-national-teams-from-all-competitions) including the World Cup.

> Football is fully united here and in full solidarity with all the people affected in Ukraine. Both Presidents [FIFA and UEFA] hope that the situation in Ukraine will improve significantly and rapidly so that football can again be a vector for unity and peace amongst people.

In 2023, the IOC (International Olympic Committee) has reiterated their position several times [[1]](https://olympics.com/ioc/news/q-a-on-solidarity-with-ukraine-sanctions-against-russia-and-belarus-and-the-status-of-athletes-from-these-countries)[[2]](https://olympics.com/ioc/news/q-a-on-solidarity-with-ukraine-sanctions-against-russia-and-belarus-and-the-status-of-athletes-from-these-countries) that Russian and Belarusian athletes can only compete as Individual Neutral Athletes.

Despite IOC recommendations Poland banned Russian and Belarusian athletes from [the 2023 European Games](https://notesfrompoland.com/2023/03/29/russians-and-belarusians-banned-from-european-games-in-poland-despite-ioc-recommendations/). In Paris, the 2024 Olympic host city,  event organizers [cancelled a World Cup fencing event](https://apnews.com/article/fencing-france-russia-ukraine-2821983e726628c8bbf21e1eb8dd8c76) after the FIE (International Fencing Federation) [decision](https://apnews.com/article/fencing-russia-ukraine-olympics-9754e17d554df4484c609248019bd1a9) to allow Russian athletes to resume competing one year after the invasion of Ukraine. 

Looking back at previous Olympics, Russia's Track and Field team was [barred from the 2016 Olympics](https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/18/sports/olympics/russia-barred-rio-summer-olympics-doping.html) over a decade long doping scandal. 68 Athletes filled appeals that were ultimately [dismissed by the Court of Arbitration for Sport](https://www.nbcsports.com/bayarea/russians-lose-track-appeal-ioc-weigh-total-ban-rio), though [some](https://www.insidethegames.biz/articles/1133394/russia-ana-athletics) Russian athletes were able to compete as 'Authorized Neutral Athletes'. At the 2016 Paralympics the entire Russian Paralympic team was banned over the same doping scandal.

para_P.title: Are athletes from Russia going to be excluded from the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if athletes from Russia are excluded from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games under any of the following conditions: (i) representing the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. The resolution will be based on the official roster of countries and athletes attending the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media sources indicating that the 2024 Olympics are taking place or have finished without the involvement of Russian athletes. For the question to be marked as **Yes**, no more than 34 Russian athletes should be competing at the 2024 Olympics. The number 34 was selected as 10% of [Russian athletes that took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to permit a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If the number of competing Russian athletes exceeds 34 at the 2024 Olympics, then this question will be marked as **No**.

In the event that the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this question will be deemed ambiguous.

para_P.title: Will athletes from Russia be prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if athletes from Russia are prohibited from participating in the 2024 Olympic Games under any of the following: (i) the Russian flag, (ii) the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) any other independent or neutral flag. The resolution will depend on the official roster of countries and athletes participating in the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible media reports that confirm the commencement or conclusion of the 2024 Olympics without the involvement of Russian athletes. For a **Yes** resolution, the number of Russian competitors at the 2024 Olympics must not exceed 34. This figure was determined as 10% of the [Russian athletes that took part in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to accommodate a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

Should more than 34 athletes from Russia compete at the 2024 Olympics, the answer will be **No**.

If the 2024 Olympics are either cancelled or rescheduled to 2025 or later, this question will be deemed ambiguous.

para_P.title: Are Russian athletes going to be barred from competing in the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** response if Russian athletes are barred from competing in the 2024 Olympic Games under any of the following circumstances: (i) under the Russian flag, (ii) under the flag of the Russian Olympic Committee, or (iii) under any other independent or neutral flag. The determination will rely on the official list of countries and athletes participating in the [2024 Olympics](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/paris-2024) or credible news sources that verify the start or conclusion of the 2024 Olympics without the participation of Russian athletes. A **Yes** answer requires that the number of Russian competitors at the 2024 Olympics does not surpass 34. This limit was established as 10% of the [Russian athletes who competed in the 2020 Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Olympic_Committee_athletes_at_the_2020_Summer_Olympics) to allow for a few individual or sport-specific exceptions.

If more than 34 athletes from Russia participate in the 2024 Olympics, the response will be **No**.

In the event that the 2024 Olympics are cancelled or postponed to 2025 or later, this question will be considered unclear.

question.title: Will S&D hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the S&D holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.background_info:
The [European Parliament](https://www.citizensinformation.ie/en/government_in_ireland/european_government/eu_institutions/european_parliament.html#:~:text=The%20European%20Parliament%20is%20part,member%20states%20every%205%20years.) is a key legislative body within the European Union (EU) that shares lawmaking responsibilities with the Council of the European Union. Comprising [705](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/news/en/faq/11/how-many-meps) directly elected Members of the European Parliament (MEPs) from EU member states, the Parliament holds elections every five years. While it cannot initiate legislation, the European Parliament can approve, reject, or amend proposed laws, and it also supervises EU institutions and budgets.

During [European parliamentary elections](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/at-your-service/en/be-heard/elections), candidates run as representatives of their national parties, which are typically affiliated with political groups in the European Parliament. Once elected, Members of the European Parliament (MEPs) officially join political groups based on shared ideologies and policy objectives that align with their national parties. According to the [EU Parliament website](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/about-parliament/en/organisation-and-rules/organisation/political-groups), the following political groups are currently present in the European parliament:

| Group Name | Abbreviation |
|------------|--------------|
| Group of the European People's Party (Christian Democrats) | EPP |
| Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament | S&D |
| Renew Europe Group | RE |
| Group of the Greens/European Free Alliance | Greens/EFA |
| Identity and Democracy Group | ID |
| European Conservatives and Reformists Group | ECR |
| The Left group in the European Parliament  | GUE/NGL |

In the [2019 elections](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/election-results-2019/en), the seats were allocated as follows between the political groups: 

| Group Name | Abbreviation | Seats |
|------------|--------------|-------|
| Group of the European People's Party (Christian Democrats) | EPP | 182 |
| Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament | S&D | 154 |
| Renew Europe Group | RE | 108 |
| Group of the Greens/European Free Alliance | Greens/EFA | 74 |
| Identity and Democracy Group | ID | 73 |
| European Conservatives and Reformists Group | ECR | 62 |
| Non-Inscrits | NI | 57 |
| Confederal Group of the European United Left - Nordic Green Left | GUE/NGL | 41 |
| **Total Seats** | | **751** |


The next European parliamentary elections are [scheduled for 2024](https://multimedia.europarl.europa.eu/en/package/european-elections-2024_23001), with [polling](https://europeelects.eu/ep2024/) indicating a narrow lead for the EPP in early 2023.

reformat_metaculus_question.original_question: Which political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? (S&D)
reformat_metaculus_question.original_body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** for the political group that holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

metadata.background_info:
Linda Yaccarino, the former advertising chief of NBCUniversal, has been [appointed as the CEO of Twitter](https://edition.cnn.com/2023/05/12/tech/twitter-ceo-linda-yaccarino/index.html) by Elon Musk, the owner of the platform. She's expected to [assume the role in late June, 2023](https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1656748197308674048). The selection of Yaccarino indicates Musk's focus on Twitter's advertising business and his plans to revamp the social network into  [X, the “everything app”](https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/may/11/elon-musk-twitter-new-ceo).  Yaccarino has a strong background in the advertising industry and is known for her influential role in Madison Avenue.

Assuming the role of Twitter CEO, Yaccarino will face various challenges, including Twitter's struggles to expand its advertising business, gaps in expertise and technical glitches, and the company's substantial debt. Additionally, she will have to navigate the unpredictable nature of working with Musk.

para_P.title: Is Linda Yaccarino set to be the CEO of Twitter by July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino holds the title of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official statements from Twitter or reliable news outlets.

para_P.title: Is Linda Yaccarino set to hold the position of CEO at Twitter by July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino occupies the role of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, based on official communications from Twitter or reliable news outlets.

para_P.title: Will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter by the date of July 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino is in the CEO position at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or trustworthy news sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

metadata.background_info:
From [Reuters on May 24, 2023](https://www.reuters.com/technology/openai-may-leave-eu-if-regulations-bite-ceo-2023-05-24), "OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said on Wednesday the ChatGPT maker might consider leaving Europe if it could not comply with the upcoming artificial intelligence (AI) regulations by the European Union."

The [EU AI Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_Intelligence_Act) "regulates the providers of artificial intelligence systems, and entities making use of them in a professional capacity." As of May 24, 2024, [Metaculus expects](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/8787/passing-of-the-ai-act/) the AI Act to be passed between Oct 2023 and Nov 2024, with a median of April 2024, though OpenAI could choose to cease offering ChatGPT in Europe earlier than that, or for some other reason entirely.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "widely accessible" means that the default situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not available in certain EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to specific groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive outcome if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT by OpenAI be accessible to the general public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible to the general public" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may require payment). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), this will still be considered a positive resolution, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered a positive resolution if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems powered by Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will the general public in the European Union be able to access ChatGPT by OpenAI by the date of June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a response of **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is available to the general public in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

In this context, "available to the general public" indicates that the typical scenario for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without requiring a VPN (though it may involve a fee). If it is not accessible in particular EU countries (as was seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is unavailable to specific demographics (such as minors), this will still be regarded as a favorable outcome, provided that more than half of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" pertains to the standard web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. A positive outcome will still be acknowledged if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service continues to function fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems driven by Large Language Models).

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.background_info:
Following the 2020 US election, Former President Donald Trump has hinted his intentions of running again for President in 2024, [saying at a rally in March 2022](https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-promises-to-return-to-the-white-house-in-2024-2022-3), "[...] in 2024, we are going to take back our beautiful White House [...] I will be back and we will be better and stronger than ever before".  [Early polling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) for the Republican Party nomination frequently shows Trump as the top choice among respondents.  

Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has not publicly expressed his intention of running (as of [June 2022](https://floridapolitics.com/archives/531919-ron-desantis-swats-away-2024-speculation-yet-again/)), though Fox News producers have [called him](https://www.tampabay.com/news/florida-politics/2021/08/13/inside-fox-news-desantis-is-the-future-of-the-party-and-hes-taking-advantage/) "the future of the Republican Party".  DeSantis is a frequent [second-place favorite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) in polling behind Trump.

question.title: Will Anthropic publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

From [Microsoft](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/openai/concepts/red-teaming), "historically described systematic adversarial attacks for testing security vulnerabilities. With the rise of LLMs, the term has extended beyond traditional cybersecurity and evolved in common usage to describe many kinds of probing, testing, and attacking of AI systems." Note that this question only asks about _safety_, not _security_. [Google](https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/6625378258649088/google-and-alphabet-vulnerability-reward-program-vrp-rules) and [OpenAI](https://bugcrowd.com/openai) already have bug bounties for security.

para_P.body: This question will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, Anthropic issues a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **YES** if, on or before June 30, 2024, Anthropic releases a *public* report that includes the findings from an *independent* organization assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, OpenAI publishes a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

metadata.background_info:
On July 21, 2023, the White House announced ([fact sheet](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/statements-releases/2023/07/21/fact-sheet-biden-harris-administration-secures-voluntary-commitments-from-leading-artificial-intelligence-companies-to-manage-the-risks-posed-by-ai/), [full report](https://www.whitehouse.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/Ensuring-Safe-Secure-and-Trustworthy-AI.pdf)) that Amazon, Anthropic, Google, Inflection, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI have voluntarily committed to manage AI risks.

The voluntary commitments are in three categories (a) "Ensuring Products are Safe Before Introducing Them to the Public", (b) "Building Systems that Put Security First", and (c) "Earning the Public’s Trust", and are "designed to advance a generative AI legal and policy regime".

From [Microsoft](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/openai/concepts/red-teaming), "historically described systematic adversarial attacks for testing security vulnerabilities. With the rise of LLMs, the term has extended beyond traditional cybersecurity and evolved in common usage to describe many kinds of probing, testing, and attacking of AI systems." Note that this question only asks about _safety_, not _security_. [Google](https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/6625378258649088/google-and-alphabet-vulnerability-reward-program-vrp-rules) and [OpenAI](https://bugcrowd.com/openai) already have bug bounties for security.

reformat_metaculus_question.original_question: Will these AI labs publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024? (OpenAI)
reformat_metaculus_question.original_body: For each AI lab, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is OpenAI going to release a report detailing the outcomes of external safety red-teaming of their models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **YES** if OpenAI issues a *public* report by June 30, 2024, showcasing the results from an *external* entity that conducted red-teaming on the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that OpenAI will release a report detailing findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered **YES** if, on or before June 30, 2024, OpenAI issues a *public* report containing the findings from an *external* organization assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI publish a report summarizing the results from independent safety assessments of their models by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **YES** if, by or before June 30, 2024, OpenAI releases a *public* document that includes the findings from an *outside* entity evaluating the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be charged with witness tampering in Georgia before June 1, 2024?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is charged or indicted for any statements related to potential witnesses in *[The State of Georgia v. Donald J. Trump, et al](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia)*. The indictments must occur before June 1, 2024.

metadata.background_info:
On August 14, 2023, former President Donald Trump was [indicted](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prosecution_of_Donald_Trump_in_Georgia#Indictment) by a grand jury in Georgia, alongside 18 other individuals. The state brought charges against Trump related to Trump's alleged participation in an attempt to overturn the state's 2020 presidential election results.

Trump made statements on his social media platform, Truth Social, which [appeared to warn](https://www.axios.com/2023/08/14/trump-witness-tampering-georgia-indictment) potential witnesses not to testify against him.

> Former President Donald Trump posted on Truth Social, his social media platform, on Monday saying Georgia’s former Lt. Gov. Geoff Duncan “shouldn’t” testify in grand jury proceedings this week regarding allegations that Trump attempted to overturn the 2020 election results in the state—and some legal analysts are saying the post could be witness intimidation or tampering.

> ...

> Per Georgia law, anyone who attempts to [influence](https://law.justia.com/codes/georgia/2020/title-16/chapter-10/article-5/section-16-10-93/) a witness is subject to felony charges and, if convicted, can face one to five years in prison; anyone who [threatens](https://law.justia.com/codes/georgia/2022/title-16/chapter-10/article-2/section-16-10-32/#:~:text=Attempted%20Murder%20or%20Threatening%20of%20Witnesses%20in%20Official%20Proceedings,-Universal%20Citation%3A%20GA&text=shall%20be%20guilty%20of%20a,nor%20more%20than%2020%20years.) a witness is subject to felony charges and, if convicted, faces 10 to 20 years in prison. ([Forbes](https://www.forbes.com/sites/mollybohannon/2023/08/14/trump-suggested-a-witness-shouldnt-testify-in-georgias-grand-jury-proceedings-critics-say-thats-witness-intimidation/?sh=7e14b52a57be))

question.title: Will Erling Haaland score the most goals in the 2023/24 Premier League season?
question.body: The question resolves **Yes** if Erling Haaland is the player with the largest number of goals after each of the 20 PL teams plays their 38th game of the 2023/24 season, [according to Oracle Cloud via the PL website](https://www.premierleague.com/stats/top/players/goals?se=578)

metadata.background_info: Erling Haaland plays for Manchester City, a football team which competes in a number of competitions, including the Premier League.

para_P.title: Is Erling Haaland going to be the top scorer in the Premier League for the 2023/24 season?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if, after all 20 Premier League teams have completed their 38th match in the 2023/24 season, Erling Haaland has the highest goal tally, as reported by Oracle Cloud through the Premier League website.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Erling Haaland to achieve the highest goal tally in the 2023/24 Premier League season?
para_P.body: This question will resolve to **Yes** if, at the conclusion of the 38th match for each of the 20 Premier League teams in the 2023/24 season, Erling Haaland holds the record for the most goals scored, as reported by Oracle Cloud via the Premier League website.

para_P.title: Can Erling Haaland secure the top goal count in the 2023/24 Premier League season?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the final match of the 38 played by each of the 20 Premier League teams during the 2023/24 season, Erling Haaland is recognized as the player with the highest number of goals scored, according to Oracle Cloud as stated on the Premier League website.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

metadata.background_info:
*This question is modeled on [this Metaculus question](https://www.metaculus.com/questions/18606/trump-removed-or-blocked-from-the-ballot/), but asks instead about the possibility of Trump's removal from primary election ballots.*

The 14th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution has a section known as the "Disqualification Clause" or Section 3, which may disqualify individuals from holding federal or state office if they have "engaged in insurrection or rebellion against the [U.S.], or given aid or comfort to the enemies thereof." Given the events surrounding the January 6, 2021, riot at the U.S. Capitol, this section has become a subject of considerable debate with respect to former President Donald Trump's eligibility to run for federal office again.

In New Hampshire, Bryant "Corky" Messner, an attorney who ran for U.S. Senate in 2020 with Trump's endorsement, has [expressed intentions to file a legal challenge](https://www.forbes.com/sites/alisondurkee/2023/08/29/trump-14th-amendment-new-hampshire-gop-feuds-as-states-grapple-with-disqualifying-trump-from-ballot/?sh=70038b512e9a) questioning Trump's 2024 candidacy under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The Republican Secretary of State of New Hampshire, David Scanlan, while not actively seeking to remove any candidates, has stated that he will seek legal advice on the issue. Additionally, Michigan’s Democratic Secretary of State Jocelyn Benson has indicated that she will seek a legal opinion on this matter. Voters have also filed lawsuits in Florida and Michigan on the issue. Legal battles are widely expected, and these disputes might reach the U.S. Supreme Court.

This question focuses on whether these and similar ongoing discussions and legal challenges will result in Donald Trump being removed from the primary election ballot of any state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15th, 2024, the planned start of the 2024 Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the stipulations of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not suffice for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later changes that may happen after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the outlined criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to face removal or disqualification from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of the removal or disqualification must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or disqualified from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or disqualified from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role as per Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with a "Yes" if, by July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or disqualified from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal role (President, Senate, House of Representatives) in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The validation of the removal or disqualification must come from official announcements by state governments, court decisions, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not suffice for a conclusion.

The answer will be "No" if these criteria are not met by July 15, 2024.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account any legal challenges, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may occur after the specified date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or disqualified from a ballot and then later reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or disqualified from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.background_info:
Following the 2020 US election, Former President Donald Trump has hinted his intentions of running again for President in 2024, [saying at a rally in March 2022](https://www.businessinsider.com/trump-promises-to-return-to-the-white-house-in-2024-2022-3), "[...] in 2024, we are going to take back our beautiful White House [...] I will be back and we will be better and stronger than ever before".  [Early polling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) for the Republican Party nomination frequently shows Trump as the top choice among respondents.  

Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has not publicly expressed his intention of running (as of [June 2022](https://floridapolitics.com/archives/531919-ron-desantis-swats-away-2024-speculation-yet-again/)), though Fox News producers have [called him](https://www.tampabay.com/news/florida-politics/2021/08/13/inside-fox-news-desantis-is-the-future-of-the-party-and-hes-taking-advantage/) "the future of the Republican Party".  DeSantis is a frequent [second-place favorite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_United_States_presidential_election#Republican_Party_2) in polling behind Trump.

Former Vice President Mike Pence has also hinted his intentions of seeking the nomination; [in April 2022](https://archive.ph/uFSD4), when asked if he would run even if Donald Trump were also running, he responded "We’ll go where we’re called".

question.title: Will the Milwaukee Bucks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Milwaukee Bucks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams and if the Bucks are eliminated from contention.

metadata.background_info: [The Milwaukee Bucks, Boston Celtics, Denver Nuggets and Phoenix Suns have the best odds as of the preseason.](https://sports.betmgm.com/en/blog/nba/finals-odds-championship-nba-betting-bm05/) There is a steep drop-off after that, though the Golden State Warriors and Los Angeles Lakers also have decent odds and multiple future Hall-of-Famers.

question.title: Will Real Madrid win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Real Madrid wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams resolve "No".

metadata.background_info: [The UEFA Champions League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League) (previously known as the European Cup, abbreviated as UCL, or sometimes, UEFA CL) is an annual club association football competition organised by the Union of European Football Associations (UEFA) and contested by top-division European clubs, deciding the competition winners through a round robin group stage to qualify for a double-legged knockout format, and a single leg final. The 2023/24 edition features 32 teams, with the final being played on the 1st of June 2024 at Wembley Stadium.

question.title: Will the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 in the US occur within four weeks of the combined peak for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the maximum weekly rate of hospitalizations per 100,000 for each of COVID, influenza, and RSV that occurs in the 2023-24 season is less than or equal to four weeks (28 days) from the date of the maximum rate for all three combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four weeks will be based on the week end dates. The CDC uses "epidemiological weeks" which begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate used will be that for all ages, races, and sexes. See the fine print for the correct filters. For the purposes of this question, the 2023-2024 season will be considered to begin with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and end on the week ending June 1, 2024.

To allow for data revisions and reporting delays the question will resolve according to data shown after the reporting delay period, when the relevant figures for the current season is not shown as a dashed line, typically 4 weeks after the week end date.

metadata.background_info:
The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) closely monitors respiratory illnesses, particularly when these illnesses increase in prevalence during the winter. One monitoring and data sharing tool the CDC uses is [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html), which it describes as follows:

>The Respiratory Virus Hospitalization Surveillance Network (RESP-NET) comprises three networks that conduct population-based surveillance for laboratory-confirmed hospitalizations associated with COVID-19, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), and influenza among children and adults. While RESP-NET does not collect data on all hospitalizations caused by respiratory illnesses, it can describe hospitalizations caused by three viruses that account for a large proportion of these hospitalizations. Surveillance is conducted through a network of acute care hospitals in select counties or county equivalents in 12 states for RSV surveillance, 13 states for COVID-19 surveillance, and 14 states for influenza surveillance. The surveillance platforms for COVID-19, RSV, and influenza (known as [COVID-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/covid-data/covid-net/purpose-methods.html), [RSV-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/rsv/research/rsv-net/overview-methods.html), and [FluSurv-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/weekly/influenza-hospitalization-surveillance.htm), respectively) cover more than 30 million people and include an estimated 8-10% of the U.S. population.

The underlying source data for the RESP-NET dashboard can be found at [this link](https://data.cdc.gov/Public-Health-Surveillance/Rates-of-Laboratory-Confirmed-RSV-COVID-19-and-Flu/kvib-3txy).

In its [Respiratory Disease Season Outlook](https://www.cdc.gov/respiratory-viruses/whats-new/2023-2024-season-outlook.html) for 2023-24, the CDC describes the 2022-23 peak as a "tripledemic" due to high incidence of COVID, flu, and RSV at the same time. The [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html) figures for the 2022-23 season show a large combined peak hospitalization rate of 22.2 per 100,000 for the week ending December 3, 2022, coinciding with the maximum rate for flu and less than a month from the maximum rate for RSV which occurred during the week ending November 12, 2022, and also less than a month from the maximum rate for COVID which occurred on the week ending December 31, 2022.

para_P.title: Will the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 people in the US happen within four weeks of the combined peak for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV in the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) from the date when the combined peak for all three is recorded, as per the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week period will be calculated based on the end dates of the weeks. The CDC defines "epidemiological weeks" starting on Sunday and concluding on Saturday. The rates considered will encompass all demographics, including age, race, and gender. Refer to the detailed guidelines for the appropriate filters. For this question, the 2023-2024 season will commence with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and will conclude with the week ending June 1, 2024.

In order to accommodate data updates and reporting delays, the resolution of this question will depend on the data available after the reporting delay period, when the pertinent figures for the current season are represented without being indicated as a dashed line, typically four weeks post the week ending date.

para_P.title: Will the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 individuals in the US take place within four weeks following the combined peak of COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the highest weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season occurs within four weeks (28 days) of the peak rate for all three viruses combined, as per the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week period will be determined by the end dates of the weeks. The CDC employs "epidemiological weeks" starting on Sunday and concluding on Saturday. The rate will encompass all ages, races, and genders. Please refer to the fine print for the appropriate filters. For this question, the 2023-2024 season is defined as starting with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending on June 1, 2024.

To accommodate data revisions and reporting delays, the resolution of the question will be based on data available after the reporting delay period, specifically when the relevant statistics for the current season are not represented as a dashed line, which is typically four weeks after the week ending date.

para_P.title: Will the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 people in the United States occur within four weeks after the combined peak of COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a **Yes** answer if the peak weekly hospitalization rate per 100,000 for COVID, influenza, and RSV during the 2023-24 season takes place within four weeks (28 days) following the peak rate for all three viruses combined, according to the CDC's [RESP-NET](https://www.cdc.gov/surveillance/resp-net/dashboard.html). The four-week timeframe will be defined by the conclusion dates of the weeks. The CDC utilizes "epidemiological weeks" that begin on Sunday and end on Saturday. The rate will include individuals of all ages, races, and genders. Please consult the fine print for the relevant filters. For this inquiry, the 2023-2024 season is identified as starting with the week ending on October 7, 2023, and concluding with the week ending on June 1, 2024.

To account for data adjustments and reporting delays, the determination of this question will rely on data available after the period of reporting delays, specifically when the pertinent statistics for the current season are not indicated as a dashed line, which is generally four weeks following the week ending date.

question.title: Will Tyson Fury defeat Oleksandr Usyk to become the Undisputed Heavyweight Boxing Champion?
question.body: The question resolves Yes if Tyson Fury wins the boxing bout against Oleksandr Usyk. It will resolve No if Usyk wins or there is a draw. If there is no fight between the two boxers before May 19th, 2024, the question is annulled.

metadata.background_info:
The heavyweight matchup is scheduled to take place on 18 May 2024 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. This fight will be for the [undisputed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Undisputed_championship_(boxing)) heavyweight champion. Both fighters are currently undefeated in their professional careers. 

According to Wikipedia: 

>[Tyson Luke Fury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tyson_Fury), "Gypsy King" (born 12 August 1988) is a British professional boxer. He has held the World Boxing Council (WBC) heavyweight title since 2020. 

>Height	6 ft 9 in (206 cm)
Reach	85 in (216 cm)
Stance	Orthodox
Boxing record
Total fights	35
Wins	34
Wins by KO	24
Draws	1



>[Oleksandr Oleksandrovych Usyk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oleksandr_Usyk) (Ukrainian: Олекса́ндр Олекса́ндрович У́сик; born 17 January 1987) is a Ukrainian professional boxer. He has held multiple world championships in two weight classes, including the unified heavyweight titles since 2021, and the Ring magazine title since 2022. He has also held the International Boxing Organization (IBO) title since 2021. 

>Height	6 ft 3 in (191 cm)
Reach	78 in (198 cm)
Stance	Southpaw
Boxing record
Total fights	21
Wins	21
Wins by KO	14

para_P.body: The inquiry will conclude with a Yes if Tyson Fury emerges victorious in the boxing match against Oleksandr Usyk. A No will be the result if Usyk wins or if the match ends in a draw. If there is no contest held between the two fighters prior to May 19th, 2024, the question will be rendered void.

para_P.body: The outcome will be Yes if Tyson Fury secures victory in the boxing match against Oleksandr Usyk. It will result in No if Usyk emerges victorious or if the match ends in a draw. Additionally, if the two fighters do not compete before May 19th, 2024, the question will be considered void.
