question.title: Will Kalenjin athletes win both the men's and women's marathon races at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if both the winner of the men's and winner's marathon at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris have Kalenjin roots, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
The Kalenjin people, native to Kenya, [dominate racing in distances between 800m and the marathon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kalenjin_people#Sport).  It is estimated that 40% of the top honours available to men in international athletics at these distances (Olympic medals, World Championships medals, and World Cross Country Championships honours) have been earned by Kalenjin runners, in spite of the ethnicity representing less than 0.1% of the human population.

Will they win both the men's and women's marathon at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

para_P.title: Are Kalenjin runners going to secure victories in both the men's and women's marathon events at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if both the male and female marathon champions at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris are of Kalenjin descent, as per [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Are Kalenjin runners set to emerge victorious in both the men's and women's marathon events at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if both the male and female marathon champions at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris are of Kalenjin descent, as per [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Will Kalenjin athletes claim victory in the marathon competitions for both men and women during the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the champions of the male and female marathon events at the 2024 Paris Olympics are both from the Kalenjin community, according to [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: At the Paris Summer Olympics in 2024, will the men's 100m dash winning time break the Olympic record of 9.63s?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete runs the Men's 100M race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63s, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
The [100m dash](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/100_metres) is one of the highlights of track and field events, with the world champion often referred to as "the world's fastest man".

The [current Olympic record](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men%27s_100_metres_world_record_progression) was set by Jamaican sprinter Usain Bolt's at the 2012 London Olympics. Will it be broken in Paris 2024?

para_P.title: Will the winning time for the men's 100m sprint at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics surpass the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any competitor completes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in under 9.63 seconds, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. Conversely, if this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the winning time for the men's 100m sprint at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics surpass the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any competitor completes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in under 9.63 seconds, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. Conversely, if this does not occur, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Will the time taken to win the men's 100m race at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics exceed the Olympic record of 9.63 seconds?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if any athlete finishes the Men's 100M event at the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics in less than 9.63 seconds, according to results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other credible sources. If this does not happen, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Olympic record for the men's pole vault be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if at the 2024 Paris Olympics, any men's pole vault athlete clears the bar at 6.04m or higher, according to results posted by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or credible sources. If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
Brazilian pole vaulter Thiago Braz set the Olympic record for the men's pole vault at 6.03m at the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympics. Since then, the world record [has risen to 6.24m](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Men%27s_pole_vault_world_record_progression), set by Swedish athlete Armand Duplantis earlier in 2024. In 2020, his only chance so far to break the Olympic record, the Swede did succeed at his 6.19m WR attempt, though he had already won gold with 6.02m.

With Braz suspended from the current Games on account of doping, will his record be broken by the dominant world record holder, or maybe by another competitor?

The men's pole vault [is scheduled](https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/schedule/athletics/men-s-pole-vault?day=3-august) to begin August 3, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the men's pole vault Olympic record to be surpassed during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if any male pole vaulter successfully clears a height of 6.04m or more at the 2024 Paris Olympics, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. If no athlete achieves this, the answer will be **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the men's pole vault Olympic record will be surpassed during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, during the 2024 Paris Olympics, any male pole vaulter manages to exceed the height of 6.04m, based on results published by the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other reliable sources. Conversely, if this does not occur, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Could the men's pole vault Olympic record be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with a **Yes** if any male pole vaulter achieves a height greater than 6.04m during the 2024 Paris Olympics, according to results from the [International Olympic Committee](https://olympics.com/en/olympic-games/olympic-results) or other trustworthy sources. If this does not happen, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

metadata.background_info:
Although most events in the Summer Olympics are contested by individual athletes, or small teams of 2-4, a few have one single larger team representing their entire country. [These are](https://olympics.com/en/paris-2024/information/team-sports-how-can-your-team-qualify-for-the-paris-2024-olympics):

* Association football
* Basketball 5×5
* Basketball 3×3
* Field hockey
* Handball
* Rugby sevens
* Volleyball
* Water polo

(Beach volleyball is listed on the source but excluded from the question because two teams from each nation can qualify, unlike the other sports.)

Will the women's teams of the same nation win at least two of these sports? The

para_P.title: Could a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) claim gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have achieved triumph in at least two of these competitions for the question to resolve as **Yes**.

The resolution of the question can occur as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will take place (e.g. if neither team competing in the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, for the question to resolve as **Yes**, the same NOC must have triumphed in at least two of these competitions. 

The resolution can occur as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will take place (for instance, if neither team competing in the final of the last event has won any of the previous ones).

para_P.title: Is it possible for one nation to achieve success in several women's team sports at the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **No** if women's teams from eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) earn gold medals in these eight team sports during the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- soccer 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

On the other hand, the answer will be **Yes** if the same NOC secures victory in at least two of these events. 

The conclusion can be reached as soon as it becomes clear that one of these outcomes is inevitable (for example, if neither team in the final of the last event has won any of the earlier competitions).

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

metadata.background_info: [Tennis at the Olympics](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tennis_at_the_2024_Summer_Olympics) has five events: singles for men and women, and doubles for men, women and mixed. This makes it possible for the same athlete to win more than one medal. Will it happen?

para_P.title: Is it possible for a tennis player to secure multiple medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any tennis player manages to earn two or more medals during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Can a competitor win more than one medal in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will receive a response of **Yes** if at least one competitor obtains two or more medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Gold medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a small number of countries; the United States alone has won nearly 20% of every gold medal ever awarded, and a total of eight countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are over 100 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal. In recent Games, the number of countries that won their first gold were:

* London 2012: 3
* Rio de Janeiro 2016: 9
* Tokyo 2020: 3

Will this number be 5 or more this year?

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will a minimum of 5 nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: This question will be answered as **Yes** if 5 or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will five or more nations secure their inaugural gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if five or more nations achieve their first Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: At the 2024 Olympic Games, will at least five countries win their first-ever gold medal?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if at least five countries earn their initial Olympic gold medal during the Paris Olympics, according to [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a fairly small number of countries; the United States alone has won about 1 out of every 6 medals ever awarded, and a total of ten countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are about 60 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal; the most recent countries to win their first medal, in the Tokyo 2020 Games, were Burkina Faso, San Marino and Turkmenistan.

Will at least 5 new countries win their first medal at the current Games?

para_P.title: Is it possible for a minimum of 5 nations to achieve their inaugural Olympic medal during the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if 5 or more nations secure their first Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Are there going to be 5 or more nations that achieve their inaugural Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry is answered with **Yes** if 5 or more nations secure their first Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Will 5 or more countries earn their first Olympic medal during the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This question is considered answered with **Yes** if 5 or more countries obtain their initial Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

metadata.background_info:
On June 27, 2024, Joe Biden and Donald Trump held their first debate as part of the campaign for the 2024 presidential election. Biden's debate performance was [widely seen as poor](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-trump-june-debate-poll/), and prompted calls for Biden to drop out, including [from the New York Times editorial board](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and, as of July 5, [three House Democrats](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4755497-seth-moulton-biden-presidential-race/).

The Biden team has reportedly been [taking action](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/04/politics/biden-rising-tide-pressure-reelection-bid-analysis/index.html) to reverse recent perceptions, and has [so far insisted](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4754840-biden-campaign-denies-dropout-rumors/) that Biden will not be dropping out. However, the New York Times [reported](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/03/us/politics/biden-withdraw-election-debate.html) that the Biden team has internally acknowledged that they must turn perceptions around quickly.

According to [538's presidential polling average](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) (when accessed on July 5, 2024), on the date of the debate Trump held a +0.2 percentage point lead in the polling averages, which has since widened to a +2.4 percentage point lead for Trump reported for July 5. The near-term polling trend may be critical as Biden weighs whether to stay in the race ahead of the [2024 Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Democratic_National_Convention), which is scheduled to be held August 19th through the 22nd.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure denotes a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in favor of Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: Will the lead that Trump has over Biden on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, be greater than 2 but less than 3?
para_P.body:
This question will be determined by the difference favoring Donald Trump over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number reflects a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates a lead for Biden. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive number of 2.4 for this inquiry.

metadata.background_info:
On June 27, 2024, Joe Biden and Donald Trump held their first debate as part of the campaign for the 2024 presidential election. Biden's debate performance was [widely seen as poor](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-trump-june-debate-poll/), and prompted calls for Biden to drop out, including [from the New York Times editorial board](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/06/28/opinion/biden-election-debate-trump.html) and, as of July 5, [three House Democrats](https://thehill.com/homenews/house/4755497-seth-moulton-biden-presidential-race/).

The Biden team has reportedly been [taking action](https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/04/politics/biden-rising-tide-pressure-reelection-bid-analysis/index.html) to reverse recent perceptions, and has [so far insisted](https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4754840-biden-campaign-denies-dropout-rumors/) that Biden will not be dropping out. However, the New York Times [reported](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/07/03/us/politics/biden-withdraw-election-debate.html) that the Biden team has internally acknowledged that they must turn perceptions around quickly.

According to [538's presidential polling average](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) (when accessed on July 5, 2024), on the date of the debate Trump held a +0.2 percentage point lead in the polling averages, which has since widened to a +2.4 percentage point lead for Trump reported for July 5. The near-term polling trend may be critical as Biden weighs whether to stay in the race ahead of the [2024 Democratic National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Democratic_National_Convention), which is scheduled to be held August 19th through the 22nd.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the reported difference in favor of Donald Trump compared to Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, if on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead by 2.4 points, this would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden be greater than 2 but no more than 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved based on the margin between Donald Trump and Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart from July 15, 2024, when assessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this scenario, a positive number suggests a lead for Trump, while a negative number indicates that Biden is in front. For example, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure indicates Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

metadata.background_info:
As per the Olympic Committee’s [recommendations](https://olympics.com/ioc/news/strict-eligibility-conditions-in-place-as-ioc-eb-approves-individual-neutral-athletes-ains-for-the-olympic-games-paris-2024) from earlier this year, Russian and Belarusian athletes will be allowed to participate in the 2024 Games as long as they do so as so-called "Individual Neutral Athletes" (AINs), without an accompanying national flag or anthem.

The Russian Federation/Russian Olympic Committee has won an average of 19 gold medals in the last 3 Olympic Games, and Belarus has averaged  1.7.

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve at Least 15 Gold Medals in the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 15 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the Games are finished, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

Otherwise, the market will conclude with a "No".

If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the Games are completed, the market will immediately resolve to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Secure 15 or More Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This market will be resolved with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively earn 15 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics. The final decision will rely on the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other trustworthy sources if IOC data is unavailable. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

Should it be verified that Individual Neutral Athletes have achieved 15 or more gold medals prior to the conclusion of the Games, the market will promptly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: On July 21, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX be greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body: This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance.

metadata.background_info:
The [Bombay Stock Exchange Sensitive Index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BSE_SENSEX), also known as the S&P BSE SENSEX or simply the SENSEX, is a stock market index consisting of 30 of the largest companies listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange. It is one of the oldest and most widely followed equity indices in India. The SENSEX is intended to reflect the overall performance of the Indian stock market.

India's recent general elections saw incumbent Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party, the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), win a [narrower victory](https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/india-election-modi-bjp-lost-majority-election-surprise-rcna155557) than expected, raising concerns about potential policy paralysis and the ability of the government to implement key economic reforms. As a result, in the immediate aftermath of the elections, the SENSEX has experienced significant volatility, beginning with a [drop of almost 6%](https://www.aljazeera.com/economy/2024/6/5/india-election-why-modis-narrow-win-has-the-stock-market-in-a-spin) on June 4th, followed by a significant bounce on June 5th.

para_P.title: Will the BSE SENSEX close above 75,000 but at or below 76,000 on July 21, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined by the closing price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Will the final price of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, exceed 75,000 but not surpass 76,000?
para_P.body: This inquiry resolves based on the closing price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as reported by Yahoo Finance.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, to be greater than 75,000 yet remain below 76,000?
para_P.body: This question is determined by the final trading price of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, as documented by Yahoo Finance.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

metadata.background_info:
In May 2024, sunspot region AR3664, now designated as AR3697, returned to face Earth after merging with another active sunspot region, resulting in numerous M- and X-class solar flares that caused intense [geomagnetic storms and auroras](https://earthsky.org/earth/auroras-last-night-extreme-solar-storm-wow-millions-may-10-11-12-2024/) visible at unusually low latitudes. 

As AR3697 [returns to face Earth](https://www.space.com/return-aurora-causing-sunspot-june-solar-storm-prospects) in early June 2024, space weather forecasters anticipate ongoing geomagnetic activity and are closely monitoring the region's continued potential to produce extreme space weather. 

[Sunspots](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunspot) are areas of intense magnetic activity that often give rise to solar flares and coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which can disturb Earth's magnetosphere and impact satellite operations, power grids, and navigation systems.

The [K-index](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-index), which measures fluctuations in Earth's magnetic field, ranges from from 0 to 9. The NOAA Space Weather Scales uses the Kp values to classify the severity of geomagnetic storms from G1 (minor) to G5 (extreme), equating to Kp values of 5 to 9, respectively.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the most intense geomagnetic storm register a K-index ("Kp") that exceeds 5 but does not surpass 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the peak Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 5 and at most 6, as per the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm reach a K-index ("Kp") that exceeds 5 but does not surpass 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 5 and at most 6, as per the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: From July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the highest geomagnetic storm attain a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 but not exceeding 6?
para_P.body: This question will receive a Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") noted between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is above 5 and at most 6, according to the records from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day history data product.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen, this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.background_info:
[Verisign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Verisign) operates the authoritative registry for the .com generic top-level domain (TLD) under a registry agreement with the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) and a [Cooperative Agreement](https://www.ntia.gov/page/verisign-cooperative-agreement) with the US Department of Commerce (DOC). This means it is the wholesale provider of the .com TLD to every domain name registrar. The American Economic Liberties Projected [has called](https://www.economicliberties.us/press-release/ntia-and-doj-must-break-verisigns-monopoly-power-over-domain-names-advocates-urge/) this arrangement a "government-designated monopoly over domain registration." According to [The American Prospect](https://prospect.org/power/2024-06-27-government-created-most-profitable-company-verisign/):

>You have probably never heard of the most profitable company in America, and possibly the world. It’s a government-granted monopoly that feasts on high margins for a low-dollar administrative product. Today, three advocacy groups pressured the Biden administration to take down the rules in place that enable this gravy train.

>The company is called VeriSign [*sic*], and it has exclusive control of the registration system for the .com domain name. Every year, hundreds of millions of website owners pay VeriSign [*sic*] a small annual fee to keep their .com in working order. Every year, the cost of managing the database to make sure that .com websites work either stays flat or goes down, while the fee for registering a .com website goes up.

The Cooperative Agreement between Verisign and the US DOC will automatically renew for a six-year term unless the DOC provides notice of non-renewal on August 2, 2024.

According to [Bloomberg](https://archive.ph/IXZ3V#selection-1705.0-1726.0), during the 2018 renewal the Trump Administration lifted the cap on wholesale prices for *.com*. The antitrust advocacy groups have written to the Justice Department to withdraw guidance that allowed the elimination of price caps in the 2018 renewal, with the letters citing President Biden’s 2021 [executive order](https://www.whitehouse.gov/briefing-room/presidential-actions/2021/07/09/executive-order-on-promoting-competition-in-the-american-economy/) on competition.

para_P.title: Will the US government terminate its agreement that permits Verisign to oversee the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD prior to August 3, 2024?

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

metadata.background_info:
**Deadpool & Wolverine** is an upcoming blockbuster by Marvel Studios scheduled to be released on July 26, 2024 featuring the two iconic heroes from the X-Men Universe.

The recent projection from Deadline puts the domestic opening to [$160-$165 million](https://deadline.com/2024/07/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-opening-projection-1236000799/), which would not only be the best opening year-to-date (beating **Inside Out 2** with $154 million) but also a record start for an R-rated movie. 

Another projection from June was even higher, [at $200+ million](https://deadline.com/2024/06/deadpool-wolverine-box-office-projection-1235973545/).

The ticket seller Fandango [reported on May 21](https://www.gamespot.com/articles/deadpool-and-wolverine-has-strongest-day-one-ticket-pre-sales-in-franchise-history-at-fandango/1100-6523599/) that their ticket pre-sales for the movie were the site's biggest ones in 2024 up to date.

Field hockey
Handball
Rugby sevens
Volleyball

question.title: Will Poland win the 2024 Warhammer 40,000 World Team Championship?
question.body: This question will resolve Yes if Poland is the winner of the WTC 2024 as announced on the official site or the official social media of the organisation.

metadata.background_info:
Warhammer 40,000 is a miniature wargame produced by Games Workshop. Set in the far future, players collect, assemble, and paint miniature figures representing warriors, creatures, and vehicles from various factions. Players then pit their armies against each other on a tabletop battlefield. Warhammer 40,000 is currently the [most popular](https://icv2.com/print/article/56556) miniature wargame in the world.

Each year, the World Team Championship (WTC) is organized, where 8-player teams from around the world compete against each other. The teams are separated into 4 seeding groups based on past performance. In the group stage of the tournament, 10 groups are formed with 4 teams each (one from each seeding group). Group stage performance determines the overall ranking among teams, which then compete in a further 4 games following a [Swiss format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swiss-system_tournament). The team with the most total points from the group and Swiss stages is crowned the winner.

This year, the WTC takes place in Mechelen, Belgium from August 8th to 11th. 40 national teams are competing, including 5 first-time competitors: Andorra, China, Mexico, Singapore/Thailand, and South Korea. The full list of teams and seeding groups can be found [here](https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=847246644093139). Past performance can be found [here](https://worldteamchampionship.com/about/history/).

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if Poland is declared the champion of the WTC 2024 as per the official website or the organization's official social media channels.

question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.background_info:
[Gold medal wins at the Summer Olympics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All-time_Olympic_Games_medal_table) are concentrated in a small number of countries; the United States alone has won nearly 20% of every gold medal ever awarded, and a total of eight countries account for the majority of medalists.

Conversely, prior to the opening of the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, there are over 100 National Olympic Committees that have never won a gold medal. In recent Games, the number of countries that won their first gold were:

* London 2012: 3
* Rio de Janeiro 2016: 9
* Tokyo 2020: 3

Will this number be 5 or more this year?

question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

metadata.background_info:
On July 28, Venezuela held Presidential elections, but full results have not yet been published by the [National Electoral Council (CNE)](https://www.cne.gob.ve/) as of August 2. Hours after polling stations closed, the head of the CNE proclaimed the incumbent, Nicolás Maduro, the winner for a third term.

The opposition and the international community have pointed out irregularities. The CNE [asserted](https://mincyt.gob.ve/nicolas-maduro-gana-las-elecciones-presidenciales/), with 20% of ballots left to count, that Maduro's 7-point lead over the united opposition candidate Edmundo González was "irreversible", which is contradictory – by the CNE's own assertion, there were enough votes left to be counted that González could still take the lead.

Furthermore, the data published by the CNE reports no more than three numbers: the votes for Maduro (51.2% of the total), the ones for González (44.2%), and an aggregated figure for "others" (4.6%). [Analyses of the data](https://elpais.com/america/2024-08-02/quien-gano-en-venezuela-los-datos-de-la-oposicion-son-mas-verificables-que-los-oficiales.html) show that the numbers correspond *exactly* to those percentages, a result consistent with the percentages being made up and the corresponding vote counts being calculated back from them.

Meanwhile, civil society in the country has been performing an [independent, bottom-up verification of the results](https://resultadosconvzla.com/); reports generated immediately after the election by the voting machines in precincts around the country are digitized and posted online. Aggregation of these vote counts show a 37-point victory for González over Maduro.

How will the Chavista president respond? Will he publish a full, disaggregated count of the results?

para_P.title: Will the complete results of the presidential election held on July 28, 2024, be released by the Venezuelan electoral authority prior to August 12, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be considered Yes if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any branch of the Venezuelan government has disclosed results of the July 28, 2024 election claiming to reflect 100% of the votes cast, broken down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: Will the full results of the presidential election held on July 28, 2024, be released by the Venezuelan electoral authority prior to August 12, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any branch of the Venezuelan government has disclosed results from the July 28, 2024 election that claim to represent all votes cast, broken down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

para_P.title: Will the complete outcomes of the presidential election conducted on July 28, 2024, be made public by the Venezuelan electoral authority before August 12, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will receive a yes answer if [trustworthy sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, prior to Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any sector of the Venezuelan government has revealed results from the July 28, 2024 election that purport to account for all ballots cast, detailed down to the parish level (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran take military action before midnight Eastern Time on August 13th?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Iran engages in military operations on Israeli territory, airspace, or waters from July 30 to August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, it will end with a "No".

For this market, a "military operation" refers to any forceful action carried out by Iran on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, it will lead to a "Yes" resolution) that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or supported by a consensus of credible news sources. This encompasses, but is not limited to, air assaults, naval strikes, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered for this market's resolution.

Only actions taken by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have come from Iranian land, will be counted for this market's resolution. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be factored into the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Blake Lively's "It Ends With Us" outgross her husband Ryan Reynold's "Deadpool & Wolverine" this weekend?
question.body:
Resolution 

This market resolves YES "It Ends with Us" has a higher (domestic) gross than "Deadpool & Wolverine" for the weekend of August 9-11. 

Source: The "weekend" tab in BoxOfficeMojo, for August 9-11.

I will use the number listed by BoxOfficeMojo, however it is defined (e.g. typically 3-day FSS wekeend + previews).

Example: last weekend, the "Deadpool & Wolverine" grossed $96.8M, far ahead of the "Trap", which opened to $15.4M.

Context 

"Deadpool & Wolverine" has been crushing the box office, and is expected to repeat with its 3rd weekend at #1. 

The potential long shot that could dethrone it is "It Ends With Us", the adaptation of Colleen Hoover's mega-bestseller, starring (funnily enough) Ryan Reynold's wife, Blake Lively.

question.title: Will there be any break between Kagurabachi chapters 44 and 45?
question.body:
A break can be any amount of time, enough for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one.

“YES” = “Yes, there will be a break after chapter 44”

“NO” = “No, there will not be a break after chapter 44”

Plan to close this on official release, will close earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time. I do not vote in my own questions.

content.text: A break can be any amount of time, enough for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one.
“YES” = “Yes, there will be a break after chapter 44”
“NO” = “No, there will not be a break after chapter 44”
Plan to close this on official release, will close earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time. I do not vote in my own questions.

para_P.title: Is there going to be a pause between chapters 44 and 45 of Kagurabachi?
para_P.body:
A pause can refer to any duration of time sufficient for Shonen Jump to announce at the conclusion of chapters whether there will be a pause before the subsequent one.

“YES” = “Yes, a pause will occur after chapter 44”

“NO” = “No, a pause will not occur after chapter 44”

I intend to finalize this upon the official release, but will conclude it sooner if reliable leakers provide any information regarding a pause in advance. I do not participate in voting on my own questions.

question.title: Will JD Vance say "Couch" before August?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if J.D. Vance publicly mentions the word "Couch" between July 25, 5:30 PM ET and July 31, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No."

Pluralization/possessive of the word will count toward the resolution of this market.

A 'mention' includes the following:

-A verbal usage of the word "Couch".
-Any written usage of the word "Couch" published through J.D. Vance's social media or other official communication channels regardless of capitalization (@JDVance would qualify however @SenVancePress will not count).

Videos posted on his social media which were filmed outside this market's time frame will not qualify for a "Yes" resolution.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?
question.body:
Will diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before August 1, 2024?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/24034/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question resolves as Yes if before August 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports:

The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).

The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.

The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.

The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines.

If there are no such reports before that date, then this resolves as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

question.title: Will the Berkeley City Council pass the Missing Middle ordinance at its July 23 meeting?
question.body:
More information: https://darrellowens.substack.com/p/the-big-zoning-battle-of-berkeley

Must be at the July 23 meeting, resolves YES even if they pass it after midnight (on July 24), resolves YES if they water down the ordinance before passing, resolves NO if they continue the vote to a future meeting, or vote NO on the proposed ordinance.

para_P.title: Is the Berkeley City Council expected to approve the Missing Middle ordinance during their meeting on July 23?
para_P.body:
Additional details can be found at: https://darrellowens.substack.com/p/the-big-zoning-battle-of-berkeley

The decision must occur at the July 23 meeting, and it will be considered a YES even if the ordinance is passed after midnight (on July 24), or if the ordinance is weakened before approval. It will be a NO if the vote is postponed to a later meeting or if they reject the proposed ordinance.

para_P.title: Is the Missing Middle ordinance going to be approved by the Berkeley City Council during their meeting on July 23?
para_P.body:
For further details, visit: https://darrellowens.substack.com/p/the-big-zoning-battle-of-berkeley

The decision must occur at the July 23 meeting; it counts as YES even if they approve it after midnight (on July 24), counts as YES if they modify the ordinance before approval, and counts as NO if they postpone the vote to a later meeting or vote NO on the ordinance in question.

para_P.title: Will the Berkeley City Council endorse the Missing Middle ordinance in their session on July 23?
para_P.body:
For more information, visit: https://darrellowens.substack.com/p/the-big-zoning-battle-of-berkeley

The verdict needs to be reached during the July 23 session; it is considered YES even if they give their approval after midnight (on July 24), counts as YES if they alter the ordinance prior to approval, and counts as NO if they defer the vote to a subsequent meeting or reject the ordinance in question.

question.title: Will Yuki Tsunoda outscore Daniel Ricciardo at the 2024 Formula 1 Belgian Grand Prix?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Yuki Tsunoda outscores Daniel Ricciardo over the whole weekend, including sprint races. Resolves NO if they score the same non-zero number of points. If neither driver scores, resolves based on classification order in the main race.

 Markets are resolved according to these rules, which are subject to change.

para_P.title: Will Daniel Ricciardo be outperformed by Yuki Tsunoda in terms of points at the 2024 Formula 1 Belgian Grand Prix?

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, this market will conclude with a "No" if Donald Trump is deemed to have a superior chance of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden, according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. In the event that both candidates are evaluated with equal probabilities, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The definitive source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, particularly the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the specified resolution date. Any alterations in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will reach a resolution based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is available. It is possible that the market will not resolve until the July 20 data is released. Should there be no data available for July 19 by July 22 at 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

question.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
question.body:
NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."

Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

content.text: NYT: "It sounded what could be gun shots interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was hurried off the stage and appeared to be bleeding by his ear."
Resolves YES if someone intentionally shot a bullet or other bullet-like projectile* at Trump on July 13th. Resolves NO if accidental discharge or ricochet caused something to shoot towards Trump.

*I am using bullet-like projectile to mean something that is for all intents and purposes is a bullet but may not technically be a bullet. For example, I would not count a BB gun pellet since it is not plausibly lethal like a bullet would be.

para_P.title: Was there an intentional shooting aimed at Trump on July 13th?
para_P.body:
According to the NYT: "It sounded like what could have been gunfire that interrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was quickly taken off the stage and seemed to have a wound near his ear."

This will be marked as YES if an individual deliberately fired a bullet or a similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. It will be marked as NO if an accidental discharge or a ricochet resulted in something being directed towards Trump.

*The term bullet-like projectile is used here to refer to any object that acts like a bullet in terms of lethality, even if it doesn't meet the strict definition of a bullet. For example, a BB gun pellet would not be considered, as it is not likely to be lethal like a bullet.

para_P.title: Was there a deliberate shooting at Trump on July 13th?
para_P.body:
According to the NYT: "There were sounds resembling gunfire that disrupted Trump’s rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was quickly taken off the stage and seemed to have a wound near his ear."

This question resolves to YES if an individual intentionally fired a bullet or a similar projectile at Trump on July 13th. It resolves to NO if the incident was due to an accidental discharge or a ricochet that resulted in something being directed towards Trump.

*The term bullet-like projectile refers to an object that functions similarly to a bullet, though it may not be classified as one. A BB gun pellet, for instance, would not be included as it is not considered lethal like a bullet.

para_P.title: Did someone intentionally shoot at Trump on July 13th?
para_P.body:
As reported by the NYT: "Sounds that were similar to gunfire interrupted Trump's rally in Pennsylvania. Trump was swiftly removed from the stage and appeared to have an injury near his ear."

This inquiry will be answered with YES if a person aimed and fired a bullet or a comparable projectile at Trump on July 13th. It will be answered with NO if the occurrence was caused by an accidental firing or a ricochet that led to something being aimed at Trump.

*The phrase bullet-like projectile refers to any object that operates in a manner akin to a bullet, even if it does not meet the definition of one. For example, a BB gun pellet would not be included as it is not lethal like a bullet.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

content.text: Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.
Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.
This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a credible news organization report the news at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
The question will be considered TRUE if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news outlets, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not meet the criteria.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden withdraw, will a credible news source report the event at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
The question will be answered YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding the withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not meet the criteria.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: If Joe Biden decides to step down, will a reputable news outlet inform the public about it at least 6 hours in advance?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a YES answer if a prominent and reliable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's formal announcement concerning the withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy theory websites, or personal remarks on Manifold will not satisfy the requirements.

This market will be considered N/A if President Joe Biden does not announce his withdrawal before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a live, on-camera discussion for over 45 minutes prior to the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest qualifying interview was Biden's session on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he responded to questions for approximately 70 minutes. 

If Biden engages in another such live interview for a minimum of 45 minutes, this market will resolve to YES. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or an interview edited into a program like 60 Minutes. A 50-minute video might contain only 20 minutes of Biden being interviewed, and thus would not qualify.

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous segments on 60 Minutes each contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will there be a red card in either semi-final of UEFA Euros 2024?
question.body:
Will a red card be shown to any player or member of support team in either of the UEFA Euros 2024 semi-final games?

A red card is shown either for serious fouls/misconduct, or as the result of a player receiving two 'warning' yellow cards. 

The market will resolve YES if any member of any of the teams playing the semi-finals is shown a red card and sent off the pitch.

A red card is issued for serious infractions or when a player accumulates two yellow cards, leading to their dismissal. 

The outcome will be YES if any player or support team member from the competing teams receives a red card and is sent off.

A red card is issued for significant fouls or inappropriate behavior, or when a player receives two yellow cards. 

The answer will be YES if any player or team member from the competing sides in the semi-finals is given a red card and expelled from the game.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

The duration of the incapacity is not pertinent to this question.

Biden's departure from the Presidency due to death, resignation, or similar events is not considered. Biden's use of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not relevant.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a coalition of a minimum of 5 identified Democratic House Representatives or US Senators compel Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly suggested that Biden should step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one of these letters would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five identified Democratic US House Members or Senators collaboratively requests Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or actively encourages him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as a signed letter similar to what has been reported, or it could take another form, such as a group meeting with Biden in person and collectively urging him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals be part of the same group communication. If five individuals independently inform reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, this will not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats contacting Biden and requesting him to step down will not meet this market's requirements unless at least five qualifying names are publicly disclosed before the market's closing date. In any uncertain situations where such names are reported but not confirmed with high certainty, this market will lean towards resolving NO.

If these conditions are not fulfilled before July 20th, this market will resolve NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the presidency by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be resolved as YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary shift of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (The role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) does not result in a YES resolution, as the Acting President is not considered the President according to the Constitution.

para_P.title: Will Biden remain in the presidency until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be answered with YES if Biden is still serving as the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be answered with NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before that time.

A temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (like appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not lead to a YES answer, as the Acting President is not recognized as the President under the Constitution.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.
