para_P.title: If Donald Trump competes against Joe Biden instead of a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold surveys are available, both concluding on July 6. One survey prompts Manifold participants to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other invites them to vote alongside a standard Democrat on a similar ballot.

Public opinion surveys frequently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error rate, yet every other Democrat considered in these hypothetical scenarios either leads or stays within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will confirm a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer will be YES if the result of this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is at least 0.03. If not, the answer will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A and will stay open until the specified closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two Manifold polls are available, both closing on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden trails Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in this hypothetical scenario either leads or is within the error margin. Are Manifold participants reflective of the broader public?

This market will be marked YES if Trump's vote percentage in poll 1 surpasses that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, use the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The answer is YES if the formula for poll 1 minus the formula for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

These polls and this query will never result in N/A and will remain open until the specified closing time, regardless of circumstances.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden instead of a typical Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% rise among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other requests them to opt for a typical Democrat on a comparable hypothetical ballot.

Surveys of public sentiment consistently show that Joe Biden is behind Donald Trump by a margin that exceeds the margin of error, while every other Democrat assessed in this hypothetical situation either leads or is within the margin of error. Do the opinions of Manifold participants reflect those of the general public?

This market will be marked YES if Trump's vote share in the first poll exceeds that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls are finalized.

To determine the percentage of votes for Trump, apply the formula (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the result of the first poll minus the result of the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome will be NO.

These polls and this question will not yield N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time, irrespective of any circumstances.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.
Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden going to declare that he is withdrawing from the race and stepping down from the presidency prior to the conclusion of July?
para_P.body:
This will resolve to YES if Joe Biden makes an announcement stating that he is no longer pursuing re-election and that he will be resigning, thus not finishing his current term. Such announcements must occur before the end of July 2024, Pacific Time, although he does not need to have formally resigned and vacated his position by that time. A declaration of his intent to resign is adequate to resolve this market.

If not, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare his intention to both withdraw from the race and step down from the presidency prior to July's conclusion?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Joe Biden declares that he is ceasing his campaign for re-election and that he will resign, thereby not finishing his current presidential term. Such declarations must occur before the end of July 2024, according to Pacific Time, although he is not required to have officially resigned and vacated his position by that time. An announcement of his plans to do so is adequate to resolve this market.

If not, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce his decision to withdraw from the election and resign from the presidency before the end of July?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Joe Biden makes a statement indicating that he is ending his campaign for re-election and intends to resign, thus not completing his current term as president. Such statements must be made before the conclusion of July 2024, according to Pacific Time, although he does not need to have formally resigned and left his position by that date. A declaration of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

If he does not make such a declaration, this market will resolve to NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will at least 30% of Manifold respondents agree that weak AGI had been achieved before July 23, 2024?
question.body:
[image]Every month, a Manifold poll is being posted to gain the consensus view of progress towards AGI. Unlike many of the markets and questions on Manifold, these polls will simply ask "has weak AGI been achieved," rather than providing a definition of the term. The goal is that given that the term is so broad, the only way to characterize AI progress is also to allow respondents to vote based upon their own understanding.

Progress has been steady.  The previous polls are referenced here:

@/SteveSokolowski/did-openai-achieve-weak-agi-with-gp  (Answer: 15)

@/SteveSokolowski/june-2024-has-weak-agi-been-achieve  (Answer: 27)

The previous markets on this topic, which significantly understimated Manifold's belief in AI progress, were:

@/SteveSokolowski/what-percentage-of-manifold-poll-re 

@/SteveSokolowski/will-at-least-20-of-manifold-respon 

The polls will not reference any specific model, and will not define "AGI" except to state that the poll does not require that the software system be able to manipulate the physical world. The polls open on the 23rd of each month and close on the 30th.

This market will resolve to YES if the July 2024 poll results in a ratio of YES/(NO + YES) greater than or equal to 0.3. The "no opinion" respondents will be ignored. Otherwise, this question will resolve to NO.

See also:

@/SteveSokolowski/will-one-of-the-monthly-has-weak-ag

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

question.title: Will Cristiano Ronaldo score a goal during Euro 2024?
question.body:
He has yet to score a goal during the European Cup. Will he end up goalless or will he score?

Will resolve NO if he doesn't.

question.title: Stranded astronauts depart on Boeing Starliner by July 21?
question.body:
Clone of (and resolves identically to) https://polymarket.com/event/stranded-astronauts-depart-on-boeing-starliner-by-july-21?tid=1719805056151

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must depart within 45 days due to the Harmony module's limited fuel.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if the Boeing Starliner spacecraft departs the International Space Station (ISS) with NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore by 11:59 PM ET on July 21, 2024. 

The Starliner will be considered to have departed if it has undocked from the ISS and begun its return journey to Earth.

The resolution source will be official announcements from NASA and/or Boeing, however a consensus of credible reporting may also be used.

para_P.title: Are the astronauts who are currently stuck at the ISS going to depart on the Boeing Starliner before July 21?

The Boeing Starliner spacecraft, which arrived at the ISS on June 6, 2024, carrying NASA astronauts Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, must leave within 45 days due to the limited fuel available in the Harmony module.

question.title: Will there be any break between Kagurabachi chapters 40 and 41?
question.body:
A break can be any amount of time, enough for Shonen Jump to state at the end of chapters if there will be a break before the next one.

“YES” = “Yes, there will be a break after chapter 40”

“NO” = “No, there will not be a break after chapter 40”

Plan to close this on official release, will close earlier if known-accurate leakers post any details about a break ahead of time. I do not vote in my own questions.

question.title: Will Disney announce a new version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
question.body:
This will resolve YES if Disney announces that they are working on a new version of the Peoplemover at D23 in the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a new version of the Peoplemover, this attraction would need to be a ride that has portions with views above Tomorrowland AND has at least two of the following characteristics:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in the name

2) uses existing Peoplemover track structure for a portion of the ride

3) rebuilds portions of the Peoplemover track on the same alignment for the new ride

4) has a station in the old peoplemover station building

5) rebuilds the old peoplemover station with approximately similar characteristics and location 

This can resolve to YES if a new ride was announced that uses portions of the Peoplemover track and station as a part of an Incredibles ride, but would resolve to NO if an attraction called Peoplemover was announced that took place entirely inside of a show building, offering no aerial views of Tomorrowland.

para_P.title: Is Disney set to reveal a revamped version of the Peoplemover for Disneyland during D23 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if Disney discloses that they are developing a revamped version of the Peoplemover at the D23 Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

For it to qualify as a revamped version of the Peoplemover, this attraction must be a ride that features sections with views over Tomorrowland AND must possess at least two of the following traits:

1) includes "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its title

2) utilizes existing Peoplemover track structure for part of the ride

3) reconstructs segments of the Peoplemover track on the same route for the new ride

4) has a station located in the previous Peoplemover station building

5) reconstructs the old Peoplemover station with roughly similar features and position.

This can be marked as YES if a new ride was announced that incorporates segments of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles ride, but will be marked as NO if an attraction named Peoplemover was announced that occurs entirely within a show building, providing no elevated views of Tomorrowland.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Disney will reveal a revamped version of Peoplemover for Disneyland during D23 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be determined as YES if Disney discloses their plans for a revamped Peoplemover at D23 during the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

For it to qualify as a revamped version of the Peoplemover, the attraction must be a ride featuring sections with views over Tomorrowland AND must possess at least two of the following traits:

1) contains "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its title

2) utilizes part of the existing Peoplemover track structure in the ride

3) reconstructs segments of the Peoplemover track along the same path for the new attraction

4) includes a station within the former Peoplemover station building

5) renovates the old Peoplemover station with roughly similar attributes and positioning.

This can be marked as YES if a new attraction was revealed that incorporates segments of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles-themed ride, but will be marked as NO if a ride named Peoplemover is announced that occurs entirely within a show building, providing no elevated views of Tomorrowland.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Disney will announce a redesigned version of Peoplemover for Disneyland at D23 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be marked as YES if Disney reveals their intentions for a redesigned Peoplemover during the Disney Experiences Showcase on August 10, 2024.

To be considered a redesigned version of the Peoplemover, the attraction must be a ride that features sections with views of Tomorrowland AND must include at least two of the following characteristics:

1) has "Peoplemover" or "WEDway" in its name

2) makes use of part of the existing Peoplemover track structure in the attraction

3) rebuilds sections of the Peoplemover track along the same route for the new ride

4) features a station within the previous Peoplemover station building

5) updates the old Peoplemover station with roughly similar characteristics and location.

This can be marked as YES if a new attraction is announced that integrates segments of the Peoplemover track and station as part of an Incredibles-themed ride, but will be marked as NO if a ride titled Peoplemover is revealed that takes place entirely within a show building, offering no elevated views of Tomorrowland.
